name: Hilton London Metropole

reviews.text: No complaints, we were in the west wing 13th floor, room was spotless, there were 4 of us sharing. There were 2 queen beds plenty of storage, tea/coffee making facilities, bathroom was a liitle on the small side but perfectly adequate. Breakfast was really good, everything from ceareal, toast, continential and full english, also an omelette chef. when you enter the breakfast room and shown to your table they come straight over offer you fresh orange juice, tea/coffee. Did'nt use the bar or restuarant so can't comment. Only one regret is that we did'nt get to see the views from the restuarant on the 23rd floor.
reviews.title: Fab Hotel

reviews.text: Would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Tired, overpriced and struggling to keep up.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my 7 year old son in a 'standard' room, spending just short of £300 for two nights. The room was tiny and drab, but clean. Even my 7 year old, far from being an experienced world traveller was less than impressed, laughing at me for attempting to have a bath in the 'weird little mini bath' that he thought may 'have other people's diseases in it'..... The leisure facilities, a major reason for booking this particular hotel are again pretty drab and barely adequate. Add to all of this £15 for 24hrs wireless connectivity in the room, £11:50 to watch a movie on the in room service and £30 + £4:50 delivery charge for a (well deserved!) bottle of red wine up to the room and the whole thing starts to fail to stack up.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: Seems to me the Hilton is charging four star prices but delivering two star accommodation. I'm certain some of the better, more expensive rooms are nicer, but even though I'm staying in standard class and accept that, people' expectations have moved on since the 80's and this just doesn't feel 'good enough' for the money.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Was just what we need! Stayed with my girlfriend for a night. We checked in a little early and were offered a free upgrade which was brilliant! Staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was amazing. Very modern, clean and spacious. The bathroom was also fantastic, there was a bottle opener stuck to the sink, half an arm's length from the bath! Completely unnecessary but brilliant! The restaurant on the top floor was fantastic, a little pricey but the views over the city are second to none. Quite an experience at night. Highly recommended! The breakfast buffet was one of the best I've had. although it was quite a treck from our rooms! I wish we had time to use the pool and spa, unfortunately we enjoyed the bar a bit too much the night before. Highly recommend this hotel. Good value for money.
reviews.title: Very Good experience as a family hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton London Metropole July 1 - 4 with my 3 children. We had originally booked a homestay, but that reservation fell through when the owner sold the property shortly before we started our trip. I tried to book a hotel closer to the main tourist areas, but found them to be either booked, too expensive, or not able to accommodate 4 in a single room.
reviews.title: Good Experience for Family

reviews.text: Given the mixed reviews, I was a bit uneasy booking this hotel, but it tuned out to be a good experience. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon around 5pm. The lobby was busy, but check-in went quickly. We were given a room in the the newer west end of the hotel on the 9th floor. Not a great view, but the room was just fine - 2 queen beds, very comfortable. London was in the middle of a heat wave, but the air conditioning worked fine. There was an ice machine near the elevator (a big deal for us since we had just spent 3 weeks in France where ice cubes were hard to come by). We paid 138 gbp per night which included a good breakfast buffet with cooked to order omelets.
reviews.title: very unhappy HiltonHonors member

reviews.text: As other reviews have mentioned, the hotel is located in a multi-cultural neighborhood. Edgewood road had a mix of small markets, Mark & Spencer (great for snacks and sandwiches), Starbucks, McDonalds, Subway, Italian, Lebanese, and something called Old English Gentleman. We had one casual meal in Halal were we had excellent chicken kabobs, basmati rice, salad, and a drink for 5-8gbp each.
reviews.title: So many problems...

reviews.text: We took the Heathrow Express to Paddington station -- expensive, but really convenient and comfortable. No stairs to deal with, and we walked with our luggage to/from the hotel (maybe 10 minutes max). The train dropped us off right below Terminal 1.
reviews.title: This was a great hotel to end our 3 week trip of the UK with!!!!

reviews.text: Edgewood Road Underground station was right across the street. My 8 & 9 year old travelled free. An all day travel card cost me 4.90 gbp, and my 15 year old 2 gbp. System was easy to use, but do avoid evening rush hour if you can. The cars were packed and very hot. I cannot imagine traveling with suitcases given the crowds and stairs.
reviews.title: Enjoyed it very much

reviews.text: First off this is a business hotel not one for relaxation or vacationing in. That being said it is a nice place, a very happening place, the lobby always as a constant stream of interesting people to see and meet. I spent one night here in Aug. and I have to say that the staff was excellent and bent over backwards from the check in to luggage care to arrangement to get me to the airport, everyone is smiling and polite and talkative. Location to the tube is only a block away. I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Great staff!

likes.liked: — Staff and cool ethnic area it is located it.
likes.disliked: — WiFi only available in the lounge

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Metropole Edgware Rd London as part of a 4 night five day package holiday organised by the London Daily Telegraph and Hilton Hotels under the title London History Experience. The holiday itself was fine: excellent speakers; coach tours around London to well known sights; everything a London 'fan' could want. This year over 100 came along, last year over 300, the year before that 600 !!
reviews.title: Hooray for Hilton .. But .....

likes.liked: — Decor of room, cleanliness, comfort of bed,Executive lounge breakfast very good
likes.disliked: — Thick mugs instead of a cup and saucer (!), poor quality TV,small public lounge/swimming pool

reviews.text: Everyone this year stayed at the massive Hilton Metropole in heart of 'Lebanese London'. Last year we stayed in the Kensington Hilton: read on to say which we thought best..
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: This Hilton, with over 1000 rooms accommodates 1.25% of all London hotel tourists. Here the world looks after the world ! On arrival, before our feet had hardly touched the ground, an attendant shoved a form to sign under our nose before whipping our suitcase away, whist we checked in at the H Honors desk, where a pretty German girl four months into her Hilton job, checked us in and allocated us an Executive room in the East wing, where all the Executive guests stay. Ten floors high most of the rooms overlook a dull street nearby, though some may be lucky to get a London view. In contrast all other guests stay in the 22 storey high West Wing. A high room here affords great views over London to the South.
reviews.title: Nice hotel.

reviews.text: Our room was OK, if a little small. Newly renovated, very clean and fresh, with a very comfortable bed, well equipped bathroom, efficiently serviced by a young Polish lady who spoke little English, but who was delighted with the £5 tip we gave her on departure (probably in excess of her hourly rate !)- plus three packets of biscuits !! Our only gripe was the old fashioned TV with just 9 channels, no Sky Sports, (no CNN thank goodness ), plus the five main British TV channels and Sky News. The TV control didnt work properly for accessing all Teletext news pages, though you could get round that by using the channel change UP/DOWN button.
reviews.title: OK hotel - not great, not bad

reviews.text: We have never slammed a hotel before....but,
reviews.title: No TV for You...You ate Dinner!

reviews.text: The Pay TV did not work.
reviews.title: Best Hotel I Ever Stayed In!!!

likes.liked: — Friendly helpful staff/ big room and clean

reviews.text: They promised every day, for four days, to put us in a room with Pay TV. On the first night a night "receptionist" told us, "Your TV can not be turned on. You ate dinner in the Restaurant." We later found out she meant to tell us that the room account had to be reset and we had a $100 dinner bill charged against the room. The duty mgr, told us she was mistaken. Everything that could be done was done. He would put us in a different room "tomorrow." Although we talked to him for two more days, he never put us in a different room or fixed the TV. The morning we left, we got a phone call telling us, "Room service is bringing you complimentary food and water." They sent a message on fine stationary apologizing for the poor service and no TV or change of room. The food was 3 apples and the water was an 8 oz bottle.
reviews.title: Ok for Business Travelers - Close to Metro
busy, busy, busy hotel - check-in shambolic but service generally ok
reviews.text: We moved to the Hilton at Gatwick Airport. The Asst Gen Mgr told us, "The Pay TV has been out of service all over the UK for months. Simply put, they lied to you. We hear that alot." He upgraded our room for our poor experience.
The arrogance of the management is beyond poor service.
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel to Stay

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here in July 2011 for three nights, and had a very pleasant stay. I'd stay here for the help from the concierge desk alone; I had a health scare and had to go to an emergency room, and the people at the concierge desk were invaluable during that scary time.
reviews.title: Great stay.

reviews.text: While the hotel is not in an ideal tourist location (that is, there aren't any big attractions nearby), it is directly across from the Circle Line tube station, which can get you anywhere you need to go. The rooms were large (especially by UK standards) and comfortable, and the breakfast each morning was very good. Overall, I'd stay here again!
reviews.title: Old

reviews.text: Last week I stayed in the Hilton Metropole. The room was ok. But the bathroom is old. The walls were covered with "Schmimmelpilz".
reviews.title: Overpriced, Horrible Experience, Never Returning

reviews.text: The WIFI connection is very expensive (15£/24). Also there was a long wait at the reception.
reviews.title: The beds are so hard, the floor's more comfortable!!

reviews.text: Ridiculously expensive WIFI that didn't even work properly, we got better internet service at the cafe a couple of blocks away for free. There was always a long wait at reception, the staff were friendly but not one of them had any idea how to use "the system" - the amount of times we had different staff members say "I don't know how to do it in the system" or "the system must be down" was a joke. The operators who answered the "magic" phone line never sounded very "magic", it was like there was nothing in the world they'd rather be doing less than answering your call.
reviews.title: Excellent breakfast, decent rooms, good transport links

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited this hotel for 9 nights, it was very good especially that both Edgware Road stations are near by, one in the front and the other is across the bridge (the highway).
reviews.title: Visiting from Arabia - Hotel is in a quit area

reviews.text: Room is medium, not that big, cleaning is good during the stay. But they do not offer you a complementary water bottle.
reviews.title: Bigger is not always Better but it's not Bad

reviews.text: When we arrived unfortunately there was a used bottle and piece of cookie (very old one) on the table, I did not like that. When I called the reception, they said but it next to the room and somebody will take it, fortunately, they did not pay me for that :-)
reviews.title: Terrible Hotel, should not be a hilton
Very mixed quality & understaffed
reviews.text: One bad thing for the minibar and refrigerator, I asked to clean the minibar since I do not want to see alcoholic drinks in front of me, they said cleaning the refrigerator takes GBP25, which is beyond any human being thought. Do not take items out of it if you want to add your stuff since their refrigerator is using items weight to calculate mini bar usage. When I left the hotel they mentioned to me I used GPB70 cost, but they returned them back immediately when I returned them back.
The breakfast is wonderful; they have Varity of food and excellent service.
reviews.title: Had a really bad experience

reviews.text: booked through londontowns-got great deal.2 persons, 2 nights B&B and 1 Dinner for £220.00
reviews.title: great breakfast!

likes.liked: — bed in room so comfortable, had great nights sleep

reviews.title: Overpriced, really smokey & unclean tiny room - read on!
reviews.text: Hotel is close to shopping district and has 2 underground stations within 1 min walking distance from hotel.
Very nice hotel, lovely rooms, staff friendly enough.
reviews.title: don't expect too much, but OK for a bargain price

likes.liked: — comfortable mattress, ironing set and tea facilities in the room
likes.disliked: — the non-existing view, the messy wellness facilities

reviews.text: Breakfast is absolute yum....Get the chef to make you an omelette there and then in front of you - its great
reviews.title: Overpriced, Overloaded and in need of a refurb.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Selection of food is amazing.
reviews.title: Convienent Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for just the one night in February and I was very impressed. The hotel is very large but it caters well with lots and lots of staff at all times. The reception team were good, and we had a trainee when we checked out which took a painfully long time, but someone did come and help her eventually. Not blaming her at all though, she did very well under pressure from a large queue.
reviews.title: Brilliant overall!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is always very busy - which is what you'd expect from such a large hotel in central London, but as I say, the staff coped very well.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Metropole

likes.liked: — Moderness, cleanliness and convenience, and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is just a stones throw away from the tube station, which name escapes me for now, but it takes about 10 minutes to get into the touristy area of Central london. There are lots of bars and restaurants and fast food outlets close by if you don't fancy spending so much in the restaurant. But when staying in a Hilton, the food is part of the experience so I would advise eating there at least one time. Book upon check in though, it gets full quickly.
reviews.title: Bring your own pillow!

likes.disliked: — Bed and pillows were not as comfy as we would have liked

reviews.text: The best part of my stay was the room service. It was brilliant. The hot chocolate delivered to the room was the best I've ever tasted, I'm not joking. I am not easily pleased but this hot chocolate was one of the highlights of my stay! Seriously, it was that good. The food wasn't half bad either.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Metropole!

likes.disliked: — Small room size, no refrigerator for personal use

reviews.text: The concierge was friendly and, as expected very helpful. I'm trying to think of bad points but.... I am struggling. Nope, our stay was perfect and would have no hesitation in returning.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel; compact room, but extremely clean and comfortable

likes.liked: — High standards of housekeeping and service; convenient location

reviews.text: Goos hotel, very easy to get everywhere, can even walk to oxford street easily, opposite the edgware road tube station. Hotel was clean and lovely entrance at reception through to the shopping area, our room was small on the wing on the 5th floor, the bathroom wasn't 5* but then the hotel is not pretending to be either, it could do with a decorate, which I am sure will be on the Hilton list of things to do soon.
reviews.title: GOOD CENTRAL HOTEL

reviews.text: The Breakfast was brilliant! One of the best, Piping Hot and lots of choice, worth staying here just for that! Would use this hotel again if got a good deal.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Its a nice hotel, rooms are spacious. A good breakfast spread. Its a city centered hotel. The staff is co-operative & helpful.
reviews.title: An ideal base for our visit to London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very clean and bright, our guest room was very pleasant. The hotel was ideal for getting around London being so close to the tube station and Lords Cricket Ground was within walking distance. The buffet style breakfast was probably one of the best we've tasted in a hotel...delicious. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed here twice now with my partner and have been very happy twice. the hotel/room always clean lots of room. The staff alawys helpfull and the food first class. I would recomened this hotel to anybody visiting london.
reviews.title: hilton by the roadside.

reviews.text: We had a lovely stay here. Staff very accommodating, room fabulous (and apart from the fact we had to share 2 double beds with the children) and everything we needed. The breakfast was lovely, and the hotel is well located for both bus and tube. We ate in one of the restaurants one night, and it was inexpensive and the children ate well. We were less impressed with our "menu special" but overall we didn't feel it necessary to complain! It made the trip into something a bit special.
reviews.title: a great place to stay when visiting london with children

reviews.text: Stayed here for business in mid-October. The standout thing about this hotel to me is that it's a very quality experience and it's extremely easy to hop on the tube and get anywhere you need to go. The Metropole is right next to the Edgware Road tube station, which itself is only one stop on the Circle/District line from Paddington. I had to commute out to Reading for work everyday so this location was pretty ideal.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, interesting location, good overall experience

reviews.text: The area of London that it's in is definitely heavily populated by folks from the Middle East and North Africa. Lots of really good food all around, lots of shisha places if you're in to that kind of thing, and plenty of cool sites like halal butchers and such that I don't see back home. Plus it is also relatively close to Hyde Park, another perk.
reviews.title: Metropole Rip off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as amenities, it's a Hilton. It's nice, modern, plenty big (I was upgraded to a room with two double beds even though it was just me), has a good restaurant, a sports bar and more.
reviews.title: convenient to Paddington and Heathrow express

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Forget the stained towel, there is NO WIFI in the room while they charge you £15 (about $24) per day for internet! The pool hours are limited and staff is rude. All in a hotel that "caters" to conferences. What a disappointment.
reviews.title: this hotel can be very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got home from a weekend in London, We stayed at the Hilton Metropole. We chose this one because of its great transport lnks in to all the hustle and bustle. The roorn was very pleasant, awful view (just a wall) but we spent very little time in the room anyway. The staff were very helpful and friendly, one member of staff even got me some plasters for my blisters!!! We found that the room was relativly quite the only thing was our room was situated right opposite the lifts! The beds were very comfortable and the pillows were nice too which is unusual for a hotel. We didnt eat at the hotel, we ate out, but we did have our breakfast there, breakfast was included in the price of the room, but we did pay an extra £3 for room sevice in the morning, and it was really really nice the toast was hot and the fresh juice was lovely and cold, all round a really nice breakfast. I would definately stay there again!!!
reviews.title: Really nice stay!!!!!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton London Metropole March 9-12, 2007. I booked a four star room through Hotwire for $109/night ($130 with taxes.) The rack rate for the normal room was 189 GBP/night (about $359), or 239 GBP (about $454) for the executive room.
reviews.title: Great service, wonderful hotel

likes.disliked: — Not a large restaurant selection outside of the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I arrived around 1:00 PM, they were not ready for check in (3:00PM.) They were able to get me registered, and hold my bags while I went out for lunch. I returned and was able to check in promptly at 3:00. Because of my Hilton Honors status (Gold), they upgraded me to an executive room at no charge (surprising since I got the room through Hotwire.) The Executive rooms are quite large for London standards, with a king size bed, marble bath with separate tub and shower, closet, work desk, and chair. Being on the executive floor also had some additional perks - access to the executive lounge, which included free breakfast, free cocktails and beer during the afternoon and evenings, afternoon tea, and free internet access.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

likes.disliked: — The front desk somehow got the idea that we wanted to move rooms. A little confusing, but soon sorted out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was wonderful, and the staff was constantly trying to go out of their way to make me feel welcome. From the front desk crew, the restaurant and bar staff, to the well-dressed bellmen, the service here was excellent.
reviews.title: Great Value for the Money! ( as long as you don't book though the hotel)
Good hotel, average location
reviews.text: The lobby is what you expect of a four star hotel in a major metropolitan area. Large marble atrium with a lobby bar and separate sunken seating area, a separate cafe, concierge desk and business center, plus a few more restaurants and a sports bar with a bunch of TV's tuned to different sporting events. Although I did not dine at any of the restaurants, the sports bar was enjoyable (although a little pricey at 4.50 GBP for a pint of Guinness), and the lobby bar was a perfect stop for a night cap on Friday night (open until 4:00 AM, although I do not know if that is typical - there was a large somewhat rowdy group of bankers staying at the hotel that evening enjoying the libations - I retired well before the proposed closing time, and realized earlier bar times are a really good idea.)

reviews.title: OK with smaller room
reviews.text: We stayed there for 4 days on a deal from hotwire.

Got an upgrade so we could share a queen bed compared to a standard of two single beds. The room was OK - though a bit small and the window had condensation, so it was difficult to enjoy the view from the 17th floor.
reviews.title: family loved hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fitness room was well equipped though a lot of machines in the space - not many people at the time we used it.
reviews.title: really nice
Nice Hotel, easy access to Tube and Bus
reviews.text: We got internet access at 22 Pounds per day and a fridge at 5 Pounds per day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall experience and service were OK..
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Ok Location

description: Just 10 minutes’ walk from the West End and Oxford Street and a 10 minute tube ride from Westfield Shopping Centre, the Hilton London Metropole hotel is the ideal destination for the business and leisure guest. Take a stroll to Hyde Park or relax in the gym, pool or sauna. Dine on international cuisine at Fiamma Restaurant or sample Asian Fusion favourites at Minako at the Met. Take in London attractions like The Tower of London and the London Eye. Spend the evening watching Shakespeare at The Globe or enjoy concerts and sports events at Wembley Stadium, just a 30-minute train ride away from the District Line station opposite the hotel. All Hilton London Metropole hotel rooms offer high-speed internet access. Choose an Executive Room or one of our Suites for complimentary Executive Lounge access. Wireless internet access is available in all public areas of the hotel.Our common space was recently refurbished, completed October 2013.
